DataElement.preferredName: Esophageal Neoplasm Pathologic Stage Grouping CPTAC Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group based on the combination of T, N, and M categories and relevant prognostic factors for the malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus.

Concepts.longName: Esophageal Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic
Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.longName: Stage Grouping
Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/22/20 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval email.  6/10/20 jk created for CPTAC ESCA Baseline CRF - generalized AJCC level.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics._A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IVB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IVB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1, Any G, Tumor location: Any. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IVB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1, Any G, Tumor location: Any. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (T4b, N0-2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (Any T, N3, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any). T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. T4b: Tumor invades other adjacent structures, such as the aorta, vertebral body, or airway. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (T4b, N0-2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (Any T, N3, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any). T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. T4b: Tumor invades other adjacent structures, such as the aorta, vertebral body, or airway. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IIIB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IIIB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: (T2, N2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (T3, N1-2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (T4a, N0-1, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any). T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IIIB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: (T2, N2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (T3, N1-2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (T4a, N0-1, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any). T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IIIA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IIIA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: (T1, N2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (T2, N1, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IIIA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: (T1, N2, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any); (T2, N1, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IIB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IIB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIB includes: (T3, N0, M0, G2-3, Tumor location: Upper/middle); (T3, N0, M0, GX, Tumor location: Any); (T3, N0, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Unknown); (T1, N1, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IIB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIB includes: (T3, N0, M0, G2-3, Tumor location: Upper/middle); (T3, N0, M0, GX, Tumor location: Any); (T3, N0, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Unknown); (T1, N1, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Any). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IIA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IIA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIA includes: (T2, N0, M0, G2-3, Tumor location: Any); (T2, N0, M0, GX, Tumor location: Any); (T3, N0, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Lower); (T3, N0, M0, G1, Tumor location: Upper/middle). T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G1: Well-differentiated. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IIA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIA includes: (T2, N0, M0, G2-3, Tumor location: Any); (T2, N0, M0, GX, Tumor location: Any); (T3, N0, M0, Any G, Tumor location: Lower); (T3, N0, M0, G1, Tumor location: Upper/middle). T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G1: Well-differentiated. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IB includes: (T1a, N0, M0, G2-3, Tumor location: Any); (T1b, N0, M0, G1-3, Tumor location: Any); (T1b, N0, M0, GX, Tumor location: Any); (T2, N0, M0, G1, Tumor location: Any). T1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. T1b: Tumor invades the submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IB Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IB includes: (T1a, N0, M0, G2-3, Tumor location: Any); (T1b, N0, M0, G1-3, Tumor location: Any); (T1b, N0, M0, GX, Tumor location: Any); (T2, N0, M0, G1, Tumor location: Any). T1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. T1b: Tumor invades the submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated, undifferentiated. (AJCC 8th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IA includes: (T1a, N0, M0, G1, Tumor location: Any); (T1a, N0, M0, GX, Tumor location: Any). T1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well-differentiated. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IA Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IA includes: (T1a, N0, M0, G1, Tumor location: Any); (T1a, N0, M0, GX, Tumor location: Any). T1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria or muscularis mucosae. PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage 0 Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage 0 Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0, GN/A, Tumor location: Any. Tis: High-grade dysplasia, defined as malignant cells confined to the epithelium by the basement membrane. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. GN/A: Grade non-applicable. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage 0 Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0, GN/A, Tumor location: Any. Tis: High-grade dysplasia, defined as malignant cells confined to the epithelium by the basement membrane. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. GN/A: Grade non-applicable. (AJCC 8th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1, Any G. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IVB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1, Any G. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N2, M0, Any G); (T4b, N0-2, M0, Any G); (Any T, N3, M0, Any G). T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. T4b: Tumor invades other adjacent structures, such as the aorta, vertebral body, or airway. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Stage IVA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N2, M0, Any G); (T4b, N0-2, M0, Any G); (Any T, N3, M0, Any G). T4a: Tumor invades the pleura, pericardium, azygos vein, diaphragm, or peritoneum. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IC includes: (T1, N0, M0, G3); (T2, N0, M0, G1-2). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa.
